intro: Galatella grimmii subsp. microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed galatella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
